data.name: Multiply without asterisk
data.description:
Your task is to implement a class `MyNumber`, whose objects are initialized by an integer value to be represented. The following operations should be defined for `MyNumber` objects as usual: `+, -, *, /, %`. We require two additional conditions: 1. Besides using the asterisk symbol `*`, also represent the multiplication *avoiding* this symbol, using only juxtaposed expressions in brackets. 2. Let also the hat operator `^` be defined, and interpret it as a *power* (instead of bitwise 'xor').

Example

The following commands should be interpreted as follows: >>> a = MyNumber(7); b = MyNumber(8) >>> (a-1)(b-1) 42 >>> (a)(b) 56 >>> (1-a)^2 36 >>> (a-1)(a)(a+1) 336
